intro: Tricuspis seslerioides var. flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible tricuspis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trilobed leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its striking foliage and long-lasting blooms, making it a popular choice for gardens. It is relatively low maintenance and thrives in well-drained conditions.
